title: Eerie Elementary: The School Is Alive
author: Jack Chabert

book_level.description: Early chapter book - spooky school adventure with suspense elements

questions.question: What is Sam Graves chosen to be at school?
questions.explanation: Sam is chosen to be a hall monitor at Eerie Elementary.

questions.question: What are the names of Sam's two best friends?
questions.explanation: Sam's best friends are Antonio and Lucy.

questions.question: What color is the hall monitor sash that Sam wears?
questions.explanation: Sam has to wear a shiny orange sash as hall monitor.

questions.question: Who is the old man that takes care of the school?
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe is the old man who takes care of Eerie Elementary.

questions.question: What is the name of Sam's teacher?
questions.explanation: Ms. Grinker is Sam's classroom teacher.

questions.question: What play is the class putting on?
questions.explanation: The class is performing Peter Pan for Friday's play.

questions.question: Who plays Peter Pan in the school play?
questions.explanation: Antonio plays the role of Peter Pan.

questions.question: Who plays Wendy in the school play?
questions.explanation: Lucy plays Wendy in the Peter Pan play.

questions.question: What character does Sam play in Peter Pan?
questions.explanation: Sam plays Noodler, one of Captain Hook's friendly pirates.

questions.question: What does Antonio always carry in his pocket for good luck?
questions.explanation: Antonio always carries a peanut butter and jelly sandwich in his pocket as his lucky charm.

questions.question: What first tries to eat Sam at the playground?
questions.explanation: Sam's feet start sinking into quicksand on the playground.

questions.question: Who saves Sam from the quicksand?
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe grabs Sam's wrist and yanks him free from the quicksand.

questions.question: What breaks through the classroom window?
questions.explanation: The oak tree's long, twisted branch crashes through the window and grabs Sam.

questions.question: What attacks Sam in the hallway at night?
questions.explanation: A fire hose comes to life and whips around, attacking Sam.

questions.question: How does Sam stop the fire hose?

options.B: He ties it in a knot

questions.explanation: Sam grabs the hose and ties it like a giant shoelace, stopping it.

questions.question: What scary sound does Sam hear from the clock?
questions.explanation: The clock changes from tick-tock to 'ba-bump, ba-bump' - the sound of a beating heart.

questions.question: Where is Mr. Nekobe's secret room hidden?
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe has a secret room hidden behind the janitor's closet.

questions.question: What does Mr. Nekobe tell Sam about the school?
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe reveals that 'Eerie Elementary is alive' - a living, breathing monster.

questions.question: What does Sam use to defeat the monster mouth during the play?
questions.explanation: Sam kicks a giant drum of peanut butter into the mouth, which gums up the teeth.

questions.question: What are the monster's giant teeth made of?
questions.explanation: Hundreds of metal folding chairs were 'opening and closing like a set of giant, jagged teeth.'

questions.question: When Sam fell asleep on hall monitor duty, he woke up to find the halls _____ and the school coming alive.
questions.explanation: When Sam woke up, 'The halls were dark, nearly pitch black' and locker doors were slamming.

questions.question: Sam's locker smelled terrible like _____ because the living school was breathing through it.

options.B: really bad breath from a mouth
options.C: rotten eggs left in the sun

questions.explanation: The smell was like 'really bad breath' - it was the living school breathing through the locker.

questions.question: Mr. Nekobe was Eerie Elementary's first _____, and now he is too old and weak to fight alone.
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe was the first hall monitor. He says 'I am old and weak' - that's why Sam must take over.

questions.question: The school planned to attack during the play because hundreds of people were gathered in one place to _____.

options.D: eat, which is what the school wants

questions.explanation: The school is hungry and wants to eat. The play brings hundreds of people together for it to feed on.

questions.question: Antonio's lucky _____ gave Sam the idea to use peanut butter against the monster.
questions.explanation: When Antonio's sandwich fell into the mouth and slowed the monster, Sam got the idea.

questions.question: As hall monitor, Sam has special abilities that let him _____ the school and feel things others cannot.
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe says Sam can 'sense the school, to see and feel and hear what others cannot.'

questions.question: The morning after the school attacked Sam, everything looked normal because the school _____ overnight.
questions.explanation: The school fixed itself: 'Everything was back to normal. It was like nothing had happened.'

questions.question: Sam didn't want to be hall monitor at first because everyone _____ the hall monitor.

options.D: laughs at and makes fun of

questions.explanation: Sam says 'everyone hates the hall monitor' because they have to yell at people to get to class.

questions.question: To enter the secret room, Mr. Nekobe tugged twice on a _____.
questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe 'grabbed hold of a dim, swinging light bulb' and 'tugged twice' to open the door.

questions.question: When Sam put his hand on the wall in the secret room, he felt it gently _____ like breathing.
questions.explanation: Sam 'heard the soft sound of air blowing. And he felt it. The wall was gently swaying.'

questions.question: During training, Antonio told Sam to try using things around him as _____ and weapons.
questions.explanation: Antonio told him 'Try using what's around you!' Sam grabbed a locker door as a shield.

questions.question: Lucy didn't believe Sam about the school because she thought he was losing his _____.
questions.explanation: Lucy 'thought both of her best friends were losing their minds.'

questions.question: The school trapped Ms. Grinker by making the _____ slide her into a closet.
questions.explanation: The floorboards 'lifted up to form a slide' and Ms. Grinker 'tumbled backward into the closet.'

questions.question: Antonio and Lucy were in danger because they were hanging on _____ above the monster mouth.
questions.explanation: They were 'strung up on wires high above the stage' for the flying scene in Peter Pan.

questions.question: Sam got the giant drum of peanut butter from the _____ kitchen.
questions.explanation: Sam ran to the lunchroom and into the kitchen where he found 'a giant drum of peanut butter.'

questions.question: In the lunchroom, Sam used an orange lunch _____ as a shield against flying water bottles.
questions.explanation: Sam 'grabbed an orange lunch tray' and 'held it over his chest' as a shield.

questions.question: Mr. Nekobe couldn't help during the play because curtain _____ grabbed him and threw him in a closet.
questions.explanation: The curtain ropes 'grabbed hold of' Mr. Nekobe and 'flung' him 'inside the closet.'

questions.question: Sam figured out the school would attack during the play when he read the _____ and realized everyone would be there.

options.D: script for the Peter Pan play

questions.explanation: When Sam read the play invitation, he knew 'exactly when the school would strike.'

questions.question: Lucy finally believed Sam when she saw the monster _____ for herself during the play.
questions.explanation: Lucy saw the chair monster mouth for herself and then worked with Sam to defeat it.

questions.question: The training machine was made of old _____, vending machine pieces, lockers, and hockey sticks.
questions.explanation: The machine is made of an old refrigerator, pieces of vending machine, lockers, and hockey sticks.

questions.question: What does Mr. Nekobe mean when he says the school 'feeds on students'?

options.A: The school is literally trying to eat students to survive
options.B: The school gives students food in the cafeteria
options.C: The school makes students feel hungry all the time
options.D: The school teaches students important life lessons

questions.explanation: The school is a monster that actually eats students to survive. It's been hungry for a long time.

questions.question: Why is it scary that the school can sense Sam just like Sam can sense it?

options.A: They can become friends and work together someday
options.B: Sam is never truly safe because the school knows he is its enemy
options.C: Sam can talk to the school and make it listen
options.D: The school wants to help Sam protect the students

questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe warns that the school 'knows you are its enemy' - Sam can never hide from it.

questions.question: What does Sam's story teach us about accepting responsibility?

options.A: Hall monitors are very important people at school
options.B: Schools are always dangerous places for children
options.C: Taking on hard jobs can show us how strong we really are
options.D: Adults can never help kids when there is danger

questions.explanation: Sam didn't want the job but accepts it, discovering he has the courage to be a hero.

questions.question: Why is it funny and surprising that Antonio's silly sandwich saves everyone?

options.A: Sandwiches are magical items with special powers
options.B: Peanut butter is very expensive and hard to find
options.C: Antonio is the real hero of the story not Sam
options.D: Even silly things can become important when you need them

questions.explanation: The 'ridiculous' lucky sandwich gives Sam the idea that saves everyone.

questions.question: What does it mean that the school can repair itself overnight?

options.A: The school is easy to beat forever and won't return
options.B: Sam imagined everything and nothing really happened
options.C: The school is friendly now and won't attack again
options.D: The fight is never really over because the school always comes back

questions.explanation: Even after Sam wins, the school repairs itself - this battle will continue.

questions.question: Why is it hard for Sam that most people don't believe the school is alive?

options.A: He must protect people who think he's completely crazy
options.B: It's a secret club that only he belongs to now
options.C: Adults never care about anything kids tell them
options.D: The school told everyone to be quiet about it

questions.explanation: Sam has to protect people like Lucy who think he's 'crazy' without their help.

questions.question: What does it show about the school that it waits for the right time to attack?

options.A: The school is random and attacks without thinking
options.B: The school is smart and plans carefully like a hunter
options.C: The school is sleeping most of the time during day
options.D: Mr. Nekobe secretly controls when the school attacks

questions.explanation: The school is calculating - it waits until Mr. Nekobe is weak and many people gather.

questions.question: Sam thinks 'I'll never make it' but then finds a solution. What does this teach us?

options.A: Giving up is the right choice when things get hard
options.B: Feeling scared is okay if you keep thinking and trying
options.C: Someone else will always save you in the end
options.D: Lying to yourself helps you feel better about things

questions.explanation: Sam almost gives up but remembers his training and finds a creative solution.

questions.question: Why is it ironic (funny in an unexpected way) that Sam plays a small part in the play?

options.A: Pirates aren't friendly people in real life stories
options.B: He doesn't like pirates and wanted a different role
options.C: He has almost no lines but becomes the hero who saves everyone
options.D: Pirates aren't real and shouldn't be in the play

questions.explanation: Sam has 'the worst part' with few lines, but becomes the most important person when danger strikes.

questions.question: What does it mean when Mr. Nekobe passes his job to Sam?

options.A: Adults are lazy and don't want to work anymore
options.B: Being old means you're bad at doing important things
options.C: Hall monitors have magical powers that can be given
options.D: Young people must sometimes take over when older people can't continue

questions.explanation: Mr. Nekobe is 'old and weak' and must pass his duty to Sam - the next generation takes responsibility.

questions.question: Why does the school attack when the curtain is closed?

options.A: It picks a random time to attack the students
options.B: The school loves watching plays and got excited
options.C: The audience can't see what's happening on stage
options.D: It was tired of waiting and became impatient

questions.explanation: With the curtain closed, 'The audience can't see the stage' - no adults can witness or stop it.

questions.question: Why is Sam's training with the machine important?

options.A: Training is boring but required by Mr. Nekobe
options.B: Practice helps you think clearly when real danger comes
options.C: Only people born talented can be real heroes
options.D: You don't need any help to be brave and strong

questions.explanation: Sam's training prepares him to think creatively under pressure when the real attacks happen.

questions.question: Why is it important that Sam thanks his friends at the end?

options.A: He's just being polite because that's what you do
options.B: Lucy and Antonio did all the work by themselves
options.C: Even heroes need friends and teamwork to succeed
options.D: He's lying to make them feel good about helping

questions.explanation: Sam says 'I couldn't have done it without you two' - heroes need their friends.

questions.question: What does the heartbeat sound from the clock tell us about the school?

options.A: The school is truly alive with a beating heart like a living creature
options.B: Time is running out for everyone in the building
options.C: Sam is very scared and imagining scary sounds
options.D: The clock is simply broken and making strange noise

questions.explanation: The heartbeat shows Eerie Elementary isn't just magical - it's a living organism.

questions.question: Why does Antonio help Sam even when he's not sure the school is really alive?

options.A: Antonio believes everything that people tell him always
options.B: True friends support each other even when things seem unbelievable
options.C: Lucy told him to help Sam with the training
options.D: Antonio saw proof before anyone else in the school

questions.explanation: Antonio helps even while saying 'I'm still not sure we aren't crazy' - that's true friendship.

questions.question: Why does Sam say 'Just trust me' when he leaves Lucy in danger?

options.A: He doesn't care about her safety at all
options.B: Lucy is too weak to help him fight the school
options.C: Sometimes you have to leave loved ones briefly to get help
options.D: He's running away from the fight because he's scared

questions.explanation: Sam must leave Lucy and Antonio in danger to get peanut butter - trust is essential.

questions.question: Why does the author describe the school as old and crumbling?

options.A: Old buildings are very common in most small towns
options.B: The decaying look makes the school seem more scary and wrong
options.C: It saves the town money to use old buildings
options.D: Kids prefer old schools to new modern ones

questions.explanation: The school looks like 'an old castle made of crumbling red brick' - decay suggests something evil.

questions.question: Why doesn't Sam's mom believe his story about the school?

options.A: Parents are mean to their children and don't care
options.B: She's secretly part of the school and hiding it
options.C: Adults never listen to kids at all about anything
options.D: The story sounds too crazy for an adult to believe

questions.explanation: When his mom asks for 'the real reason,' it shows adults can't imagine such a strange truth.

questions.question: What does Mr. Nekobe mean when he calls Sam 'the school's enemy'?

options.A: Sam hates going to school like most students do
options.B: Sam is the only one who can stop the school from hurting students
options.C: The school made a mistake choosing Sam as monitor
options.D: Sam failed too many tests and got in trouble

questions.explanation: As hall monitor, Sam is the school's natural opponent - the one person able to fight it.

questions.question: What is the main message of The School Is Alive?

options.A: Schools are always scary and dangerous places for students
options.B: You should never become a hall monitor at your school
options.C: Adults can never be trusted to help children in danger
options.D: Regular kids can be heroes with responsibility and friends

questions.explanation: Sam goes from a kid who hates his job to a hero who saves everyone with his friends' help.
